SENT.plain: Infantile cortical hyperostosis (ICH, OMIM 114000) is a rare familial disorder which affects infants
It spontaneously heals in the first years of life
The disease is characterized by regressive subperiosteal hyperosteogenesis mainly affecting long bones, mandible, clavicles, and ribs which are remarkably swollen and deformed on X-rays
But it is also important to take into consideration the autosomal dominant pattern of inheritance to detect it
In 2005 Gensure et al. detected 3040C â†’ T mutation in COL1A1 gene in three unrelated ICH families
Four generations of patients belonging to the same family were examined in our study
Molecular testing has now disclosed a pathogenic mutation in nine of them
Although our paper shows a distinct correlation between R836C mutation and ICH, there is a certain interindividual and intra-familial variability
